page.title: 07PREFABRICATED HOUSES,UNSTONE
page.content: In 1950 Mrs. Edna Adams, her husband & 4 ch. moved into 29, Loundes Rd., Unstone Green. One of 78 Duplex homes, prefabricated and erected in days. Intended to last for 10 yrs, in 1985 still tenanted. Aluminium shell, lined with board, known locally as{"Steel Houses."} Semi-detached with two storeys. Hall, kitchen, dining room; upstairs, two large bedrooms, a third room, bathroom & toilet. Mrs. Adams, now 67 & widowed, likes her home. "I have all the woods & fields behind me. I like the street & I like my neighbours." Admits house cold in winter "and very hot in summer!" In 1950 weekly rent 12 shillings. DHSS now pay. Does own gardening. No garage, never owned car.
